items.label: prop-dalg-locality
items.title: Locality of Algorithmic Distance
items.content:
1760: :label: prop-dalg-locality
1761: 
1762: The regularized algorithmic distance $d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)$ depends only on the states of walkers $j$ and $\ell$:
1763: 
1764: $$
1765: d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) = \sqrt{\|x_j - x_\ell\|^2 + \lambda_{\text{alg}} \|v_j - v_\ell\|^2 + \varepsilon_d^2}
1766: 
1767: $$
1768: 
1769: **Consequence (Derivative Locality)**: For any walker $i$ with $i \neq j$ and $i \neq \ell$:
1770: 
1771: $$
1772: \nabla_{x_i, v_i} d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) = 0
1773: 
1774: $$
1775: 
1776: since the expression for $d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)$ contains no dependence on $(x_i, v_i)$.
